revised_title: Chloride Channels and Transport Mechanisms in Toad Skin
tldr: The study investigates the binding and transport of anions in living tissues, specifically chloride channels in toad skin. The researchers found that the passive pathway in toad skin exhibits current rectification, with a larger conductance for outward currents. They also discovered that the time response of the current to applied potential steps revealed a time-dependent conductance increase, similar to voltage-gated cation channels in excitable membranes. The study provides insight into the mechanisms of chloride transport through the chloride-conductive pathway in toad skin.
